title: Wembanyama wows with 40-point performance
content: Victor Wembanyama paced the Spurs to a runaway win over the Mavericks, his 40 points the most for a player in a season opener in San Antonio franchise history.

title: No. 1 pick Flagg assesses Mavs debut: 'Not great'
content: Cooper Flagg became the fifth Dallas player to record a double-double in his NBA debut, but the results for him and the Mavericks against the Spurs on Wednesday night did not measure up to the anticipation.

title: Edgecombe's 34 most in debut since Wilt in '59
content: Sixers rookie VJ Edgecombe lit up the Celtics with 34 points on Wednesday night, the most in an NBA debut since Wilt Chamberlain had 43 in 1959, as the Sixers won 117-116.

title: 'Banged up' KAT plays opener with Grade 2 strain
content: Knicks center Karl-Anthony Towns said he was "hurting" in Wednesday night's season-opening win over the Cavs, in which he had 19 points and 12 rebounds despite playing with a Grade 2 quad strain.

title: Middleton: Reception in Milwaukee 'meant world'
content: After 12 seasons and 735 games with the Bucks -- highlighted by winning the 2021 NBA championship -- Khris Middleton played his first game as a visitor in Milwaukee on Wednesday night, this time as a member of the Wizards.

title: Vols' Vitello makes MLB history as Giants skipper
content: Tennessee coach Tony Vitello has been named the new manager of the San Francisco Giants, the team announced Wednesday.

title: Fields shrugs off Jets owner's criticism of his play
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields shrugged off criticism from team owner Woody Johnson, saying he's not seeking a conversation to clear the air.

title: Payton: No intent to offend Wilson with comment
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said he didn't mean to criticize Russell Wilson by saying he had told Giants officials that he had hoped to face him instead of Jaxson Dart

content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 8. Plus, here are the unsung role players and nonstarters on each roster.

content: Replay challenge success rates have increased by about half this year, largely fueled by a new camera angle.

content: The 2025 season was the closest Seattle has come to the World Series -- and the team believes the best is yet to come.

content: Less than two weeks after LaLiga said Barcelona would play Villarreal in Miami, the first regular-season game abroad has been scrapped. What happened?

content: Formula 1 ventures to Mexico City for round 20 of the 2025 season. Find out how the championship shapes up and everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to loan Barcelona goalkeeper Ter Stegen?
content: Chelsea are continuing to explore the market for a goalkeeper, with Barcelona's Marc-Andr√© ter Stegen a potential option on loan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ranking the 10 greatest NWSL teams of all time: Who's No. 1?
content: Let's rank the 10 best NWSL teams since the league launched in 2013. How many Portland Thorns, Seattle Reign and Orlando Pride squads make the list?

title: 'Illegal immigrant': Indian-origin man arrested after major truck crash kills 3 ‚Äî watch
content: A 21-year-old Indian national, Jashanpreet Singh, faces charges after allegedly causing a fatal crash on Interstate 10 while driving an 18-wheeler under the influence. The incident, which claimed three lives and injured others, highlights concerns over commercial driver licensing for non-citizens. Singh had reportedly entered the US illegally in 2022.

title: Tejashwi to be INDIA bloc‚Äôs CM face, Mukesh Sahani among two deputies: Key takeaways
content: The Mahagathbandhan has officially declared Tejashwi Yadav as its chief ministerial candidate for the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections. Mukesh Sahani will be the deputy chief ministerial face. This announcement aims to present a united front against the ruling NDA. The alliance emphasizes its commitment to serving Bihar and bringing about change for its people.

title: No oil from Russia soon? Trump sanctions to hit India‚Äôs crude imports
content: New US sanctions on major Russian oil firms Rosneft and Lukoil are likely to lead India to halt crude oil procurement from Russia, which constituted over 36% of its imports this year. Indian refiners are reviewing documentation to ensure compliance, with upcoming orders expected to shift to alternative sources.

title: Watch: How Gill reacted to a fan yelling 'Pakistan zindabad' after shaking hands - new video
content: Indian captain Shubman Gill was surprised when a fan shouted "Pakistan Zindabad" after shaking hands in Adelaide. The pre-meditated encounter, captured on video, occurred as India prepares for a crucial second ODI against Australia, trailing 0-1 in the series.

title: Google hits new milestone: CEO Sundar Pichai celebrates; Elon Musk responds
content: Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, running a new algorithm 13,000 times faster than the best supercomputers. This breakthrough, named Quantum Echoes, can explain atomic interactions and paves the way for drug discovery and materials science. The verifiable result marks a significant step towards real-world quantum computing applications.

title: Massive fire breaks out at Mumbai high-rise: Several people trapped
content: A Level-II fire erupted at the JNS Business Center on SV Road in Jogeshwari West, Mumbai, this morning around 10:50 am. Fire brigade teams are actively engaged in dousing the flames at the high-rise building. The origin of the blaze remains unknown as investigations are ongoing. Further updates are expected.

title: UP man kills wife, buries body beneath bed; sleeps over it for 12 days
content: A man in Bahraich, UP, has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and burying her body under their bed, sleeping over it for 12 days. Phoola Devi's family grew suspicious after noticing freshly plastered mud and alerted the police, who discovered her decomposed body with multiple injuries. The motive is suspected to be infidelity.

title: ‚ÄòInka kachra inke ghar mein dalo‚Äô: Harpalpur CMO dumps garbage in BJP leader‚Äôs home ‚Äì video
content: A municipal chief in Madhya Pradesh allegedly ordered garbage dumped inside a former BJP leader's home after finding litter outside. The official claims he asked the leader to use a waste cart, but the leader became argumentative, leading to a fine. The BJP leader denies this, stating he only pointed out delayed waste collection.

title: Why Europe's fight with Chinese chip company Nexperia 'worried' GM, Honda among others
content: China's new export restrictions on automotive chips, following the Dutch government's intervention in Nexperia, have sent shockwaves through global automakers like GM and Volkswagen. The move, a response to "serious governance shortcomings" at Nexperia, threatens to disrupt vehicle production as companies warn of potential shortages lasting only weeks, with sourcing alternatives taking months.

title: 'Woh saatva over...': Stump mic captures Rohit's hilarious chat with Iyer - watch
content: Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer shared a funny conversation during their partnership in the second ODI against Australia. India posted 264 for 9 after a challenging start. Rohit and Shreyas built a crucial partnership to rescue the team. Harshit Rana and Arshdeep added vital runs towards the end.

title: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor'; Anand Vihar hits 'severe' category
content: Delhi's air quality remains hazardous post-Diwali, with 'severe' pollution levels recorded in Anand Vihar.  Many areas are in the 'very poor' category, prompting authorities to activate Stage II of the GRAP.  Residents report breathing difficulties as smog blankets the city, with transport and industries contributing significantly to the pollution.

title: JNU student polls on Nov 4: Check full timeline; key dates to know
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) is set for a politically charged phase as the Election Committee announces the 2025-26 JNUSU election schedule. Polling on November 4 will decide key student leadership positions amid heightened campus activity. Media speculation suggests a fiercely contested election, with alliances and manifestos reflecting both campus concerns and broader socio-political currents.

title: iPhone 17 Pro turns pink: Chemical reaction blamed; no fix yet
content: iPhone 17 Pro Cosmic Orange models are reportedly turning pink. This discoloration is linked to the porous nature of anodized aluminum, which can absorb chemicals like hydrogen peroxide found in some cleaning products. Apple advises against using such agents, recommending alcohol wipes instead. Owners are urged to handle devices with care to preserve the vibrant finish.

title: Sushant Singh Rajput‚Äôs family rejects CBI closure report, calls it ‚ÄòEyewash‚Äô
content: Sushant Singh Rajput‚Äôs family has rejected the CBI closure report, calling it an ‚Äúeyewash.‚Äù The CBI found no evidence of wrongdoing by Rhea Chakraborty. The family‚Äôs lawyer criticized the report‚Äôs lack of supporting documents and plans to file a protest. The Patna court will hear the case on December 20.

title: Russia launches strikes across Ukraine, killing 6; seizes two more villages
content: Ukraine endured a devastating overnight missile and drone assault, claiming six lives and injuring at least 36. Critical infrastructure, including power plants and a kindergarten, was hit. Meanwhile, Russia announced capturing two more villages, as former US President Trump suggested Ukraine might cede territory for peace.

title: 10 arthritis myths busted: Exercise is safe and age isn‚Äôt the only risk factor
content: Arthritis affects millions in the UK, yet misconceptions persist, leading to delayed diagnosis and ineffective management.  This article debunks common myths, clarifying that arthritis can impact all ages, is not a single condition, and that exercise is beneficial. Understanding the facts is crucial for managing symptoms and maintaining quality of life.

title: Air pollution risks still underestimated, says doctor; shares personal health measures
content: Doctor warns air pollution risks, especially post-Diwali, are underestimated.  Immediate symptoms like cough, breathlessness, and eye irritation signal danger.  He advises staying indoors, wearing masks outdoors, limiting strenuous activity, and maintaining a healthy diet.  Healthcare systems must prepare for respiratory and cardiac spikes.  Proactive measures are crucial for public health.

title: Asia Cup trophy row: Naqvi stays adamant about ceremony; ACC informs BCCI of the date
content: The impasse over the Asia Cup trophy continues as the BCCI reportedly seeks to arrange a handover with ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi. Naqvi has proposed a formal ceremony in Dubai on November 10 for the Indian team to receive the trophy, following India's refusal to accept it at the previous presentation.

title: Karan Johar's Ozempic joke: What you ought to know about weight loss drug
content: Ozempic, a diabetes drug, is gaining traction for weight loss, fuelled by celebrity buzz like Karan Johar's transformation. While studies show significant weight reduction, potential side effects like gastrointestinal issues and rare vision problems exist. Experts emphasize it complements lifestyle changes, not replaces them, and medical supervision is vital for safe and effective use.

title: Indore: Cong leader Pravesh Agrawal dies as fire engulfs penthouse; wife, daughter survive blaze
content: Congress leader Pravesh Agrawal died of asphyxiation in a massive fire that engulfed his Indore penthouse early Thursday. The blaze, suspected to have originated in the temple area, trapped Agrawal and his elder daughter. His wife and younger daughter were hospitalized after escaping the inferno.

title: Return of the King? How Barack Obama is taking on Donald Trump
content: For most of the post-Trump years, Obama had been doing what ex-presidents do ‚Äî speeches, documentaries, the occasional Netflix moral. His politics had mellowed into podcast form: long, sincere, and algorithmically skippable.

title: Trump sanctions on Russia oil firms: What it means for Indian refiners?
content: India's state-owned refiners are scrutinizing oil contracts following US sanctions on Russian firms Rosneft and Lukoil. While India has significantly increased Russian oil imports due to discounts, refiners are verifying supplies don't directly originate from sanctioned entities.

title: Shashi Tharoor hits out at India selectors by using an Australian as example
content: Australia won the toss and chose to bowl in the second ODI against India at Adelaide Oval. India, seeking to level the series, fielded an unchanged side, sparking criticism from Shashi Tharoor over Kuldeep Yadav's omission. Australia made three changes, aiming to clinch the series. The Adelaide pitch, known for its batting-friendly nature, could favour India.

title: ‚ÄòVoting will be on Rahul‚Äôs picture‚Äô: Pappu Yadav slams Tejashwi-only poster
content: Independent MP Pappu Yadav on Thursday expressed discontent over Tejashwi Yadav being considered the Mahagathbandhan's CM candidate, stating voting will be based on Rahul Gandhi's image. He criticised posters solely featuring Tejashwi, emphasising Rahul Gandhi as the key to winning Bihar. Yadav also extended respect to Nitish Kumar, alleging BJP's betrayal.

title: 'Joint PC? But only one pic': BJP mocks 'Mahagathbandhan' presser; poster shows only Tejashwi
content: The BJP mocked the Mahagathbandhan after a press conference poster featured only RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, suggesting Rahul Gandhi and Congress were sidelined. The INDIA bloc appeared ready to announce Tejashwi as its chief ministerial candidate, with leaders meeting to resolve alliance stalemates and clear confusion ahead of Bihar Assembly elections.

title: Midnight blast halts trains in Assam: Track and sleepers destroyed near Kokrajhar
content: A massive blast, suspected to be from an IED, disrupted train services on the Northeast Frontier Railway early Thursday morning. The explosion damaged tracks between Salakati and Kokrajhar, causing an emergency halt to a goods train. While no casualties were reported, eight trains were detained, and security forces are investigating the serious security breach.

title: Bank holiday on Bhai Dooj: Will banks remain shut on October 23? Check state-wise list
content: Banks in several Indian states are closed today, October 23, in observance of Bhai Dooj and other regional festivals. This follows a series of bank holidays throughout October. While in-person banking services may be affected, customers can still utilize online banking, ATMs, and mobile apps for transactions.

title: IND vs AUS 2nd ODI: Did Kohli just retire at the Adelaide Oval? Image goes viral
content: Virat Kohli endured a difficult return to international cricket, registering his second consecutive duck in the second ODI against Australia at Adelaide Oval. Dismissed by Xavier Bartlett, this marked a career first for the star batter. Despite the recent setbacks, Kohli's impressive past record at the venue remains a notable point.

title: UK woman with Parkinson's plays clarinet during deep brain stimulation surgery
content: A 65-year-old British woman with Parkinson's disease underwent deep brain stimulation surgery while awake. During the procedure, she played her clarinet as electrodes were implanted, demonstrating immediate improvements in her finger movements. This remarkable event provided real-time feedback for surgeons and a significant personal triumph for the patient.

title: False alarm: IMD red alert fizzles as Chennai sees light rain only; schools remain closed
content: Weather alerts for heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, including Chennai, proved largely inaccurate as a low-pressure system fizzled out. While some areas saw light showers, major warnings were downgraded. Experts cite the dynamic nature of weather systems and interactions between the Bay of Bengal and Arabian Sea for the forecast discrepancies.

title: 'Putin wasn't honest': Trump imposes heavy sanctions on Russian oil firms
content: The United States is imposing significant sanctions on Russia's top oil firms, Rosneft and Lukoil, due to President Putin's perceived lack of honest engagement in peace talks with President Trump. This action follows the collapse of ceasefire discussions and the cancellation of a planned Trump-Putin summit, signaling US frustration over the stalled peace negotiations.

title: Gang-raped, threatened: Woman sexually assaulted, robbed by 5 at Bengaluru home
content: A 27-year-old woman from Bengal was allegedly gang-raped and robbed at her Bengaluru residence on Tuesday night. Five individuals reportedly entered her home, sexually assaulted her, and fled with cash and mobile phones. Police have arrested three suspects and are actively searching for the remaining two. The survivor is reported to be out of danger.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will rates fall further? Here‚Äôs what you should know
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are experiencing a downturn due to profit-taking after recent rallies. MCX Gold has corrected from ‚Çπ1,31,000 to ‚Çπ1,27,000, with potential further dips to ‚Çπ1,24,000. MCX Silver has fallen below $50 and ‚Çπ1,70,000, targeting ‚Çπ1,42,000. Global factors and Fed cues remain key influencers.

title: New blow: Kohli departs for duck; suffers never-seen-before embarrassment
content: Xavier Bartlett struck a significant blow in the second ODI, dismissing Virat Kohli for a golden duck with a well-executed lbw. This marks the first time in Kohli's illustrious 303-match career that he has been out for consecutive ducks, leaving the Indian contingent in disbelief.

title: Elon Musk criticises Nasa chief Sean Duffy for favouring Moon mission rivals
content: Elon Musk has publicly criticized NASA's chief, Sean Duffy, questioning his competence to lead the space agency. Musk's remarks stem from NASA's decision to open lunar lander contracts to multiple companies, not just SpaceX. Despite recent setbacks with its Starship program, Musk remains confident in SpaceX's ability to lead moon missions.

title: Physics in action? Police steps in as IIT Guwahati students engage in rocket-war on Diwali
content: A Diwali celebration at IIT Guwahati devolved into a dangerous 'firecracker war' between students from two hostels. The chaotic scene, with rockets and crackers launched between buildings, necessitated police intervention. The incident, captured in a viral video, saw the campus sky lit up in a manner resembling a battlefield.

title: High speed, no helmets, damaged road: Murthal outing turns ugly as 3 friends die in crash
content: A tragic late-night ride ended in the deaths of three friends on the Libaspur flyover after their motorcycle crashed into a barrier. None of the victims were wearing helmets, highlighting a persistent disregard for road safety despite increased enforcement and awareness campaigns.  Excuses for not wearing helmets are common, even as fatalities rise.

title: 'Too poor to buy crackers': Punjab family makes bomb at home; explosion kills 1
content: During the lively Bandi Chhor Divas festivities in Dharmabad village, Gurdaspur, a heart-wrenching event transpired as a homemade explosive detonated, tragically taking one life and injuring six others. The device, reportedly constructed from an iron pipe and potash by brothers struggling with financial difficulties, went off unexpectedly during its ignition.

title: US Congress‚Äô H-1B wish-list to Trump and what they mean for Indian talent
content: Seven US lawmakers have urged President Trump to withdraw the proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee and introduce reforms promoting fairer, more efficient immigration. Their proposals include stronger oversight of outsourcing firms, easier visa portability, updated wage tiers, and a balanced fee system ‚Äî measures that could reshape opportunities for Indian professionals and boost America‚Äôs innovation economy.

title: ‚ÄòLook at our neighbours‚Ä¶‚Äô: Ex-cricketer slams Cong spokesperson's remark on Sarfaraz Khan
content: Former cricketer Atul Wassan slammed Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed's suggestion that Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion from India A squads was due to his religion. Wassan expressed shame over communal narratives entering cricket, emphasizing meritocracy and India's inclusive history in the sport. He stressed that selection debates are cricketing matters, not communal ones.

title: Delhi encounter: 4 Bihar-based criminals gunned down in joint police op
content: Four men wanted in Bihar for murder and other serious offenses were killed in an early morning encounter with Delhi Police and Bihar Police. The suspects allegedly opened fire when intercepted, leading to retaliatory action. At least two to three officers were injured during the operation.

title: Understanding LDL & HDL cholesterol and natural ways to protect your heart
content: Cholesterol, vital for cell health and hormone production, requires a delicate balance between LDL and HDL. High LDL clogs arteries, increasing heart risks, while HDL acts as a scavenger.  Simple lifestyle changes like fibre-rich meals, healthy fats, nuts, fruits, vegetables, and regular exercise can naturally manage cholesterol levels, safeguarding your heart health.

title: Decoy operation foils illegal sex determination in Mysuru district
content: The operation has exposed a serious violation of the Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques Act and the Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act, said an official

title: WazirX to restart on October 24, along with crypto trading and withdrawals
content: WazirX founder Nischal Shetty said that crypto trading and withdrawals will both start from October 24

title: Obituary reference to Satya Pal Malik triggers heated exchange between NC, BJP in J&K Assembly
content: At the conclusion of the obituary references, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said Malik must have acted with the belief that he was doing good

title: Watch: Four wanted Bihar gangsters killed in police encounter in Delhi
content: A major overnight operation in Rohini, Delhi, ended with four wanted Bihar gangsters shot dead by a joint team of Delhi and Bihar Police. The slain criminals-Ranjan Pathak, Vimlesh Mahto, Manish Pathak, and Aman Thakur, were wanted for multiple serious crimes. Police say the accused opened fire first, leading to retaliatory firing. Investigations continue into the gang‚Äôs network and financial links.

title: Education, economic progress will reduce caste and religious divisions, says VIT Chancellor
content: MDMK leader Vaiko also spoke at the annual memorial lecture in honour of Dravidian stalwarts ‚ÄòPeriyar‚Äô E.V. Ramasamy and former Chief Minister C.N. Annadurai

title: Telangana bureaucrats caught between the devil and the deep blue sea, says KTR
content: BRS working president K.T. Rama Rao says senior bureaucrat S.A.M. Rizvi opting for VRS indicates the crossfire in which All India Service officers are caught in Telangana

title: Dhinakaran demands crop loss assessment in Cauvery delta
content: In a post on social media, Mr. Dhinakaran said the latest spell of heavy rainfall had damaged not only paddy but also other foodgrains, such as pulses and millets

title: Bihar election 2025: Full list of BJP candidates and their constituencies
content: BJP has fielded Satish Kumar Yadav from Raghopur Assembly seat to take on former Deputy Chief Minister and RJD Leader Tejashwi Yadav.

title: ‚ÄòBachke rehna re baba‚Äô: Congress claims PM not going for ASEAN summit to avoid meeting Trump
content: Congress claims that the reason for his not going there was that the Prime Minister doesn't want to be cornered by U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Bihar Assembly elections 2025: When will Bihar vote? Key dates, phases, and counting schedule
content: The Election Commission of India has announced a two-phase schedule for the Bihar Assembly elections 2025, with 121 constituencies voting on November 6 and 122 on November 11, followed by counting on November 14.

title: Super GST-Super Savings catches attention of everyone with special awareness programmes: Vizianagaram Collector
content: Speaking to media, he said the Union and State Governments‚Äô initiative on reduction of tax slabs had benefited people with the significant drop in prices of all essential goods, consumer products, two wheelers, cars and other products

title: Botanists from Davangere discover three new plant species; another reported for the first time in Karnataka
content: Botanists estimate existence of around 30,00,000 plant species across the globe and so far 2,50,000 species are known while 27,50,000 species are to yet be discovered

title: Bihar Assembly elections 2025: JD(U) releases full list of 101 candidates
content: The Janata Dal (United) has released the complete list of 101 candidates for the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections

title: Three arrested within 12 hours of firing on cow protection group member in Hyderabad
content: The shooting stemmed from a dispute after accused Mohammad Ibrahim Qureshi suffered losses of about ‚Çπ1 crore when victim allegedly intercepted his cattle transport vehicles

title: Senthamangalam DMK MLA K. Ponnusamy passes away
content: On October 23, he complained of chest pain and was first rushed to the Kolli Hills Government Hospital.

title: Case registered against traders‚Äô body leaders for conducting illegal lottery draw in Kerala
content: As per FIR, the accused allegedly conducted a lottery draw on October 2 with the intention to cheat Kerala government. They printed and sold coupons to public carrying logo resembling Onam Bumper lottery

title: Massive fire breaks out at business centre in Mumbai
content: According to officials, the incident was first reported at 10:51 a.m., and within a few minutes, it escalated from Level-I to Level-III

title: CM Chandrababu Naidu invites UAE investors to explore Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs growth potential
content: CM Naidu wants industrialists to bring right proposals so that government can ensure prompt clearances for setting up industries

title: Watch: Ladakh statehood talks resume: What is MHA offering?
content: Talks between Ladakh‚Äôs civil society groups and the Union Home Ministry resumed in New Delhi after last month‚Äôs deadly protests demanding Statehood. Officials hinted at possible safeguards under Article 371, but the Leh Apex Body and Kargil Democratic Alliance reiterated their demand for inclusion under the Sixth Schedule. The groups also sought the release of activist Sonam Wangchuk. With tensions high since Ladakh lost its special status in 2019, the region awaits clarity on its political future and autonomy.

title: BJP alleges desecrated idol at West Bengal‚Äôs Kakdwip shifted in prison van
content: Amit Malviya, IT chief of the BJP, accused district police officers of ‚Äúfleeing the scene with hundreds of policemen, taking away the idol of Maa Kali in a prison van‚Äù

title: Govt sets November 14 deadline for public feedback on draft rules for National Sports Governance Act
content: India‚Äôs Sports Ministry has set November 14 as the deadline for public feedback on the National Sports Governance Act draft, aimed at reforming sports administration and ensuring athlete protection

content: Here is a collection of reports published by The Hindu on Chennai city‚Äôs deteriorating road conditions

title: Piyush Goyal to discuss ways to boost trade, investments with leaders, businesses of Germany

title: Kerala DySP‚Äôs WhatsApp post on President‚Äôs Sabarimala visit sparks controversy
content: In his WhatsApp status message, Alathur DySP claimed that President flagrantly violated Sabarimala customs and that security personnel in uniform had abetted this breach of tradition. After the post sparked a controversy, he deleted it

title: Centre releases ‚Çπ665 cr. to Andhra Pradesh under MGNREGS
content: Deputy Chief Minister K. Pawan Kalyan expressed his gratitude to the Central Government for the fund sanction and release

title: IED blast on railway track disrupts train services in Assam
content: The explosion took place around five kilometres from Kokrajhar railway station on the route towards Salakati after midnight, an official said.

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT detains TDB official Murari Babu for questioning
content: SIT had earlier arraigned Murari Babu as an accused based on TDB‚Äôs Vigilance report. According to officials, a plainclothes team detained him at his house at Perunna, Kottayam, late Wednesday night

content: During the operation, the accused allegedly opened fire at the police team, prompting retaliatory action that left all four injured, the officer said

title: Indian-origin historian Sunil Amrith wins British Academy Book Prize
content: Amrith, a Professor of History at Yale University in the U.S., was born in Kenya to South Indian parents, grew up in Singapore and graduated from the University of Cambridge in England.

title: Delhi-NCR air quality remains ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô, overall AQI at 362
content: According to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) in the national capital stood at 362 as of 6 a.m. on Thursday (October 23, 2025)

title: Six held as student dies after assault during freshers‚Äô party at Latur college
content: A minor dispute that began while dancing during the bash soon escalated into violence when the victim, Suraj Shinde, had an argument with a group of fellow students.

content: VIP Chief Mukesh Sahani was named as the Deputy Chief Ministerial face of the alliance. Ashok Gehlot said, ‚ÄúOne more Deputy CM will be announced later.‚Äù¬†

title: PM Modi not to travel to Kuala Lumpur for ASEAN summit: Official sources
content: The MEA has not provided any reason for the cancellation and it is understood that the delegation in the ASEAN summit will be led by External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar

title: Nearly 35% of Chennai Metro Rail‚Äôs tunnelling completed in city for phase II project
content: Officials said, the underground construction is gradually picking up pace and this month alone, three tunnels‚Äîbetween Greenways Road and Mandaveli, Royapettah and Dr. Radhakrishnan Salai and Panagal Park to Kodambakkam‚Äîfinished their journeys.

title: Depositors of MHPFNL want State government to intervene and recover money
content: The association called for rapid recovery of assets and properties acquired using the depositors‚Äô money and full repayment of the principal along with accumulated interest.¬†

title: Indian astro community‚Äôs vision for solar physics, space weather
content: ‚ÄòThe key scientific question is understanding solar eruptions, such as solar flares and coronal mass ejections, and their potential impact on space assets like satellites orbiting earth,‚Äô Vaibhav Pant, scientist at the Aryabhata Research Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES), said

title: Tamil Nadu government to confer Vaikom Award for Social Justice to activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will present the award which carries a cash prize of ‚Çπ5 lakh, a citation and a medal.

title: IndiGo plane enroute to Srinagar lands in Varanasi after fuel leak alert; all 166 passengers safe
content: All 166 passengers on board were reported to be safe and were escorted to the arrival hall soon after landing, they said

title: Mega investment project for electric vehicle manufacturing coming up in Rajasthan
content: The plant, to be established at 65.56 acres of land, will play a crucial role in supplying affordable e-buses all over the country and promote the renewable energy sector

title: TMC says Union Govt not releasing funds to West Bengal amounts to deliberate financial strangulation
content: The West Bengal‚Äôs ruling party said that while funds have been made available to Maharashtra and Karnataka to douse their flood crisis, yet left food ravaged West Bengal has been left out in the cold.

title: Former RJD leader, convicted by CBI court, joins BJP
content: Sahani was inducted into the saffron party in the presence of Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, the party's in-charge for Assembly polls, and national general secretary Vinod Tawde.

title: Eyeing investment push, U.P. Government to open satellite investment promotion offices in five metro cities
content: U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has already approved the proposal for restructuring ‚ÄòInvest U.P.‚Äô

title: EC cancels nomination of RJD leader Shweta Suman
content: Suman‚Äôs nomination was rejected after the Commission found that she was a resident of Uttar Pradesh, making her ineligible to contest the election.

title: Protests erupt in West Bengal‚Äôs Kakdwip over ‚Äòdesecrated idol‚Äô
content: Leaders of the West Bengal BJP made serious allegations about the desecration of the idol, demanding immediate arrests and a probe into ‚Äúadministrative negligence.‚Äù

title: Fadnavis warns of strict action after namaz video sparks Shaniwar Wada row in Pune
content: Three women are booked under AMASR Rules for offering namaz inside Pune‚Äôs historic fort, Shaniwar Wada. ¬†

title: Mohan Majhi govt. hands over recruitment scam probe to CBI
content: Since roots of the scam may extend beyond Odisha to Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, and other States, CBI is the right agency to probe the scam, says Odisha govt.

title: As talks on Ladakh resume, Centre offers special provisions under Article 371
content: Home Ministry makes proposal in fresh talks with Leh, Kargil civil society groups, who continue to demand Sixth Schedule status, Statehood; groups also demand release of Sonam Wangchuk, other detained protesters

title: Uproar over elder from SC community forced to lick ground as Opposition alleges display of casteism
content: 60-year-old man from the Scheduled Caste community was forced to lick the ground near Sheetla Maataa Mandir in Kakori area on the outskirts of the State capital on Deepavali after accidentally urinating near the temple; Congress and AAP call for justice for victim

title: Ahead of pan-India SIR, Election Commission tracks voter mapping progress
content: The exercise involves standardising addresses and correcting discrepancies through house-to-house visits by booth-level officers

title: Tejashwi, Tej Pratap are poles apart in tough battle for neighbouring seats
content: One brother has the family‚Äôs support and the other is on his own; their father Lalu Prasad‚Äôs name stands Tejashwi in good stead in Raghopur, but Tej Pratap, candidate of his own party after being disowned by parents and ousted from the RJD, faces a mounting challenge in Mahua constituency

title: Political row erupts in U.P. over Adityanath‚Äôs ‚Äòhalal certification‚Äô remarks
content: Opposition accuses Chief Minister of attempting to polarise voters, divert focus from jobs and economy

title: ‚ÄòLight a lamp‚Äô campaign held in Bengaluru for fair investigation into Dharmasthala case
content: The organisers will also start a letter-writing campaign in November to further spread awareness on the demands of the campaign

title: Internal rift in grand alliance in Bihar, says BJP
content: BJP national spokesperson claims a rift in Bihar‚Äôs grand alliance hinders candidate selection, while highlighting NDA‚Äôs women empowerment initiatives

title: Show cause notices issued to nearly 1,000 West Bengal BLOs unwilling to participate in electoral process
content: BLOs refusing to participate in the electoral process have cited security reasons; they have been directed to reply within 72 hours of receiving the notice from the Chief Electoral Officer

title: Another man held in West Bengal doctor assault case
content: Total arrests rise to three; political parties continue protests over women‚Äôs safety and attacks on medical professionals in West Bengal

title: Frequent disruption of LPG cylinder supply worries households
content: In the latest incident, cylinder movement to six districts was affected as the drivers stayed away from work following a strike at BPCL LPG bottling plant at Ambalamedu

title: Assam government to introduce bills on 'love jihad,' polygamy: Himanta
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said details will be shared once the draft bills are approved by the state cabinet

title: Ruling National Conference grapples with an upset Congress, piqued MP Ruhullah ahead of Assembly, Rajya Sabha bypolls
content: Congress skips the meeting for coalition partners chaired by NC chief Farooq Abdullah and CM Omar Abdullah; ruling party battles with MP Ruhullah‚Äôs decision to keep away from campaigns

title: NHAI to deploy 3D sensors to identify potholes, road cracks across 23 States
content: Data shall be collected for all projects involving two- to eight-lane highways by deploying vehicles equipped with advanced sensors and data acquisition systems

title: Air quality level ‚Äòsatisfactory‚Äô in Bengaluru on third day of Deepavali
content: A light spell of rain on October 22 evening also could have contributed to an improvement in air quality as fewer people were seen bursting fire crackers compared to the previous two days

title: NSCN (I-M) leader Muivah returns home in Manipur after six decades
content: The State government had thwarted his earlier attempt to visit Somdal village in Ukhrul district in 2010

title: Watch: IT Ministry proposes strict rules for labelling deepfakes amid AI misuse
content: The Indian government has proposed new rules to regulate AI-generated content, requiring mandatory labeling and permanent metadata for deepfakes and synthetic media.

title: A.P. officials told to be alert as red alerts to continue till October 23 morning
content: Marripadu records 89.5 mm rain; NDRF and SDRF teams stationed in Nellore, Prakasam, Kadapa and Tirupati districts, says Home Minister

title: Congress slams Lokpal after anti-corruption body issues tender to purchase 7 BMW cars
content: Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi says it is ironic to see the anti-corruption body ordering BMWs for its members and the guardians of integrity chasing luxury over legitimacy

title: Illegal Indian Immigrant Truck Driver, High On Drugs, Kills 3 In US Crash
content: A 21-year-old Indian man-- an illegal immigrant in the US-- has been accused of causing a fiery semi-truck crash that killed three people in Southern California.

title: What US Sanctions On Russian Oil Mean For India
content: US President Donald Trump has slapped "tremendous" new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil companies in a bid to pressure his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, into ending the war in Ukraine.

title: SpiceJet Delhi-Patna Flight Returns Mid-Air Due To Technical Issue
content: New Delhi, Oct 23 (IANS) Ahead of the auspicious occasion of Chhath, a Patna-bound SpiceJet aircraft returned to Delhi on Thursday morning shortly after take-off following a technical issue.

title: Have Developed "Strong Immunity" To US Oil Sanctions: Russia
content: Russia said Thursday that new US sanctions on its oil industry risked hurting diplomatic efforts to end the Ukraine war, and that it had developed a "strong immunity" to them.

title: Multiple Nominees Will Be Allowed For Bank Accounts, Lockers From November
content: The key provisions relating to nomination under the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025 will come into effect from November 1 this year, the Finance Ministry announced on Thursday.

title: Suwayda Massacre, Execution-Style Killings: What Post-Assad Syria Looks Like
content: When rebels toppled the Bashar al-Assad regime in Syria ten months ago, the country's citizenry hoped for an end to decades of dictatorship and sectarian violence. The sweeping atrocities in Suwayda, though, paint a grim picture.

title: An Unexpected Turn: Rising Teen Athlete Deported From US To Guatemala
content: The life of a 17-year-old rising senior at Miguel Contreras Learning Complex in Los Angeles took an abrupt turn after she and her mother were detained by US immigration authorities and deported to Guatemala.

title: On Camera, Odisha Teen Filming Reel On Tracks Killed By Train
content: A 15-year-old boy, filming a reel on a railway track in Odisha's Puri, was killed after being hit by a train. The incident occurred at the Janakdevpur railway station on Tuesday.

title: Daughter's Dream, Father's Will, And Bag Of Coins: Story Behind A Scooter
content: A daughter's dream, a father's will to fulfill it, and a bag full of coins - a two-wheeler showroom in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district witnessed a heartwarming story of hope and love this Dhanteras.

title: 6 Arrested As Student Dies After Assault At Latur College's Freshers Party
content: A student died allegedly after being assaulted during a freshers' party at a private college in Maharashtra's Latur district, leading the police to arrest six people, officials have said.

title: European Aerospace Firms Join Hands To Counter Musk's Starlink
content: European aerospace groups unveiled a preliminary deal on Thursday to pool their loss-making satellite manufacturing activities, combining forces after months of negotiations to counter the runaway growth of rivals led by Elon Musk's Starlink.

title: BJP Mobilises Cadre To Ensure Migrant Voters Stay In Bihar Till Polling
content: With the two-phase Bihar Assembly elections scheduled on November 6 and 11, the BJP has launched a door-to-door campaign aimed at persuading migrant workers who return home for the Chhath Puja to remain in the state long enough to cast their votes.

title: Who Is Mahdieh Esfandiari, Iranian Citizen On Conditional Release In France
content: Iran welcomed the conditional release of its citizen, Mahdieh Esfandiari, who was arrested in February for her anti-Israel posts and protests.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Pak's Great Game: What Rawalpindi Really Wants From Its War With Afghanistan
content: Get the US in and get the money for itself - that's Pakistan's single-point agenda. And it's doing everything it can to achieve this.

title: Illegal Pre-Birth Gender Tests, Abortions Racket Busted In Karnataka
content: A joint operation by the Karnataka Health Department and police has busted an illegal female sex determination and foeticide racket in Hanuganahalli, near Bannur in Mysuru.

title: Apple Slashes iPhone Air Production After Weak Demand: Report
content: Apple has decided to cut production of iPhone Air, one of its marquee launches this year, after the device failed to impress the market.

title: Women Attacked By Mob After Dispute Over Cracker Stall, Stones Thrown At Cops
content: A minor disagreement over setting up a firecracker stall in Maharashtra's Kalyan escalated into a violent clash during Diwali. Women in the Mohane area were beaten, and stones were thrown at police officials while trying to control the crowd.

title: 14 Kids Lose Eyesight In Madhya Pradesh Playing With 'Carbide Gun' On Diwali
content: Every Diwali brings a new trend in firecrackers, from chakris to rockets to sparklers, but this year's craze has turned deadly.

title: 4 Most-Wanted Gangsters From 'Sigma Gang' Killed In Delhi Encounter
content: Four most wanted gangsters from Bihar were killed in a police encounter in Delhi early Thursday. They were wanted criminals in several heinous cases in Bihar.

title: Mumbai Cops Return Lost, Stolen Valuables Worth Rs 13 Crore To Rightful Owners
content: The Mumbai police have returned lost and stolen valuables, including jewellery and mobile phones, worth over Rs 13 crore to their rightful owners across the city, officials said on Wednesday.
